author: Lingling Wei
title: ‘The Path of Reform Is Never a Straight Line’: China’s Central Banker Says Goodbye
text:
BEIJING—China’s longest-serving central-bank chief wrapped up his 15-year reign by saying China could be “bolder” in allowing greater foreign access to its markets, while defending authorities’ backsliding on liberalization efforts.
“The path of reform and opening up is never a straight line,” said Zhou Xiaochuan at what was in all likelihood his last press conference as governor of the People’s Bank of China. “Sometimes small adjustments are needed.”
...
